description.narrative: Communities in the Targeted districts have greater knowledge about and commitment for hand washing at critical times by 2016., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: At least 85% of women and children access improved water supply facilities and 60% of households use improved sanitation and hygiene services, with a focus on vulnerable and disadvantaged communities, by end of 2016

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF IRRIGATION AND WATER DEVELOPMENT

sector.narrative: Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Communities in the Targeted districts have greater knowledge about and commitment for hand washing at critical times by 2016.

description.narrative: Over 527,250 people (259,407 male and 267,616 female) from 18 targeted districts including those affected by floods and cholera had improved knowledge on handwashing with soap at the critical times | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2018
